    All Classes and Interfaces

    Class
    Description
    Armor
    Represents a piece of armor that the hero can equip.
    Arrow
    Represents an arrow that can be fired by a ranged weapon.
    AttackAction
    Represents the intention to attack.
    BackPack
    Represents the hero's backpack grid containing placed items.
    BackPackView
    Handles the graphical representation of the backpack (the inventory grid).
    Combat
    Manages the combat logic between the hero and a group of enemies.
    CombatInteractionDelegate
    Interface allowing the combat system to initiate user interaction without directly depending on the View or Controller classes.
    CombatState
    Represents the different possible states of a combat.
    Corridor
    Represents an empty corridor room in the dungeon.
    Curse
    Represents a curse item.
    CurseAction
    Represents the intention to inflict a curse.
    Dungeon
    Represents the entire Dungeon structure.
    DungeonGenerator
    Utility class responsible for generating the fixed dungeon structure used in Phase 1 (and providing randomized elements for Phase 2 combat encounters).
    Effect
    Represents the different status effects that can be applied to an entity (Hero or Enemy).
    EnemyAction
    A sealed interface representing a planned action ("message") that an enemy announces before executing it.
    EnemyBehavior
    Interface defining the intelligence (behavior) of an enemy.
    EnemyRoom
    Represents a room containing enemies.
    Ennemi
    Represents an enemy unit in the dungeon.
    ExitRoom
    Represents the room that contains the exit door.
    Floor
    Represents a complete floor of the dungeon.
    GameView
    Handles the graphical rendering of the game using the Zen 5 library.
    Gold
    Represents a gold coin item.
    HealerRoom
    Represents a room containing a healer.
    Heros
    The player character class.
    Item
    Represents a generic item that can be placed in the hero's backpack and optionally used in combat.
    ItemInstance
    Represents an instance of an Item in the backpack.
    Jeu
    The main class for the game logic (Model).
    MagicItem
    Represents a magical item that can be used in combat.
    Main
    Main entry point for testing the backpack and item system.
    Main
    Main entry point for the game (Controller).
    MainGraphique
    Main entry point for launching the game in graphical mode using the Zen library.
    ManaStone
    Represents a mana stone that can be used in combat.
    MeleeWeapon
    Represents a physical weapon designed for close-quarters combat.
    MenuGuerisseur
    Handles the interaction logic between the player (Hero) and the Healer in a console-based interface.
    MenuMarchand
    Handles the interaction logic between the player (Hero) and the Merchant in a console-based interface.
    MerchantRoom
    Represents a room containing a merchant with a stock of items available for sale.
    Mode
    Represents the different possible states (modes) of the game.
    Position
    Represents a set of coordinates (row and column) used to locate items within the BackPack or to define the relative shape of an item.
    ProtectAction
    Represents the intention to gain protection (block).
    RangeWeapon
    Represents a ranged weapon used for attacking enemies from a distance.
    Rarity
    Represents the rarity level of an item, influencing its value, power, and appearance frequency in the game.
    RatLoupBehavior
    Concrete implementation of the behavior interface for the Rat-Wolf enemy type.
    Room
    A sealed interface representing a cell or room on the dungeon map.
    Shield
    Represents a defensive item that provides protection during combat.
    Stuff
    Enumeration listing all known item types available for generation in the game.
    StuffFactory
    A factory class responsible for creating concrete Item objects based on a weighted rarity distribution and item type Stuff.
    TreasureRoom
    Represents a room containing a treasure chest.
    View
    Console-based interaction class responsible for handling all user input and displaying the state of the BackPack and combat choices.
